bioghist.p: Children's Seashore House was founded in 1872 near Atlantic City, New Jersey, as a place for children to receive rehabilitation treatment. Funded by donations from wealthy Philadelphians, Children’s Seashore House accepted its first 55 young patients in the summer of 1873. Years ahead of its time, the hospital was the first pediatric rehabilitation hospital in the nation. In 1990 the hospital moved to its current location next to CHOP and in 1998 it was acquired by CHOP. As of 1998, the hospital had 45 beds. It currently offers provides inpatient and outpatient care for children with developmental disabilities and chronic illnesses.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records, printed matter, images and artifacts from the Children's Seashore House. Administrative records of the Seashore House include: patient registers (1874-1982, with some gaps); visitor registers (1909-1968, also with gaps); bound volumes of annual reports; charter and by-laws; strategic planning documents; brochures and postcards; newsletters; and a small amount of correspondence related to patients. Photographic materials include prints, slides, negatives, and contact sheets showing patients, staff, buildings, and events and ceremonies. The collection also includes plaques, awards, citations, architectural plans, clippings about the hospital, and the official seal of Seashore House.
